We even don't know whether agent works for Android. No one tested about this. Or for further, I think Android doesn't support agent mode at all, doesn't it?

It could be caused by duplicate services, which is original ElasticSearch performance issue. Make sure there is no duplicate service in the service traffic index alias. 
Or wait for next 8.7.0 release.

Okay, thanks for your answer. I may need to conduct more survey on Android. There may be some instrumentation techniques that can be considered.

Anyway, SkyWakling is the best practice of OpenTelemetry, and we are trying to apply SkyWalking to collect traces in a complex system environment, and then further carry out some warning and debugging work on the traces.

For example, the robot system, which contains extremely heterogeneous environment, include various languages (java, c++, python, etc.), protocols (coap, mqtt, etc.), systems (Android, linux, etc.), Even diversified hardware .

Could you please share some suggestions, that will greatly promote our work!

> It could be caused by duplicate services, which is original ElasticSearch performance issue. Make sure there is no duplicate service in the service traffic index alias.
> Or wait for next 8.7.0 release.

I use elasticsearch-7.13.3-x86_ 64 version. The data directory data of elasticsearch was deleted last Friday. Maybe for this reason, I'll take a look again. Thank you!

Java, c++ and python all have agents. Linux is more about monitoring not tracing.
Protocols don't matter, it relies on the language agent plugins in tracing case.
Yes, I will submit a PR later.
The tag is planned in 1 hour. 😄
done

The reason for the problem is that the UI images of 8.7 in the current dockerhub is wrong, `docker-entrypoint.sh` content is 

```shell
#!/bin/bash

set -e

export LOGGING_CONFIG="webapp/logback.xml"

[[ ! -z "$SW_OAP_ADDRESS" ]] && export COLLECTOR_RIBBON_LISTOFSERVERS=${SW_OAP_ADDRESS} && echo "COLLECTOR_RIBBON_LISTOFSERVERS=$COLLECTOR_RIBBON_LISTOFSERVERS"
[[ ! -z "$SW_TIMEOUT" ]] && export COLLECTOR_RIBBON_READTIMEOUT=${SW_TIMEOUT} && echo "COLLECTOR_RIBBON_READTIMEOUT=$COLLECTOR_RIBBON_READTIMEOUT"

exec java -jar webapp/skywalking-webapp.jar "$@"
```
but 8.7 changed from zuul to gateway.

The following link is correct, but it is not packaged in the image：https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docker/ui/docker-entrypoint.sh
```shell
set -e

export LOGGING_CONFIG="webapp/logback.xml"

if [[ ! -z "$SW_OAP_ADDRESS" ]]; then
  address_arr=(${SW_OAP_ADDRESS//,/ })
  for i in "${!address_arr[@]}"
  do
      JAVA_OPTS="${JAVA_OPTS} -Dspring.cloud.discovery.client.simple.instances.oap-service[$i].uri=${address_arr[$i]}"
  done
fi

exec java  ${JAVA_OPTS} -XX:+UnlockExperimentalVMOptions -XX:+UseCGroupMemoryLimitForHeap -jar webapp/skywalking-webapp.jar "$@"
```

To sum up, I guess there was a problem when packing ui-images.
